params.name: categoryId
params.doc: Id of the Category to delete

params.name: categoryId
params.doc: Id of the Category to retrieve

docs.summary:
Update a Category, supports partial update
Pass the latest `revision` for a successful update

examples.title: updateCategory example
body: const result = await categories.updateCategory(id, category, options);

members.name: appDefId
members.doc: An application definition id (app_id in dev-center). For legacy reasons may be UUID or a string (from Java Enum).

members.name: instanceId
members.doc: An instance id. For legacy reasons may be UUID or a string.

members.name: state
members.doc: An application state.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Represents the time this Category was created

members.name: _id
members.doc: Category ID

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Represents the time this Category was last updated

members.name: active
members.doc: Indication of whether the category is active and being used in live site

members.name: appId
members.doc: Application owning category

members.name: customMarkedCommentLabel
members.doc: Custom label value for marked comment badges

members.name: guestCommenting
members.doc: Setting to allow or permit guest commenting

members.name: guestReactions
members.doc: Setting to allow or permit guests to add reactions to comments

members.name: mainReaction
members.doc: The type of icons to be used for comment likes

members.name: markedCommentLabelType
members.doc: The default comment label for marked comment badges

members.name: name
members.doc: Name of the category

members.name: permissionsSettings
members.doc: Category permissions settings. Describes what UoU entities are allowed to perform actions

members.name: ratingsSettings
members.doc: Category ratings settings. Describes whether ratings are enabled for category and if leaving a rating when placing a comment is mandatory

members.name: reactionType
members.doc: The selected type of reactions to be used in comments

members.name: repliesReactionType
members.doc: The selected type of reactions to be used in replies

members.name: revision
members.doc: Represents the current state of an item. Each time the item is modified, its `revision` changes. for an update operation to succeed, you MUST pass the latest revision

description: Category is the main entity for Comments widget service

members.name: category
members.doc: Category to be created

members.name: category
members.doc: The created Category

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

Pass the relevant cursor token from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Maximum number of items to return in the results.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursor strings that point to the next page, previous page, or both.

members.name: hasNext
members.doc:
Whether there are more pages to retrieve following the current page.

+ `true`: Another page of results can be retrieved.
+ `false`: This is the last page.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor string pointing to the next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to the previous page in the list of results.

members.name: revision
members.doc: The revision of the Category

members.name: categoryId
members.doc: Id of the Category to delete

members.name: revision
members.doc: The revision of the Category

members.name: dateDeleted
members.doc: When the meta site was deleted.

members.name: deleteOrigin
members.doc: A reason (flow).

members.name: deleteStatus
members.doc: A status.

members.name: initiatorId
members.doc: A service that deleted it.

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
(for example, GDPR).

members.name: deletedEntityAsJson
members.doc: Entity that was deleted

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: categoryId
members.doc: Id of the Category to retrieve

members.doc: The retrieved Category

members.name: assets
members.doc: A list of "assets" (applications). The same as MetaSiteContext.

members.name: hardDeleted
members.doc: Emitted when meta site was permanently deleted.

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc: A meta site id.

members.name: namespaceChanged
members.doc: Emitted on a namespace change.

members.doc: Emitted when an application is provisioned (installed).

members.name: serviceRemoved
members.doc: Emitted when an application is removed (uninstalled).

members.doc: Emitted on a meta site creation.

members.doc: Emitted when meta site is marked as template.

members.name: siteMarkedAsWixSite
members.doc: Emitted when meta site is marked as a WixSite.

members.name: sitePublished
members.doc: Emitted on the first* publish of the meta site (* switching from unpublished to published state).

members.name: siteRenamedPayload
members.doc: Emitted when meta site name (URL slug) is changed.

members.name: siteTransferred
members.doc: Emitted on a meta site transfer completion.

members.name: siteUndeleted
members.doc: Emitted on a meta site restoration.

members.name: studioUnassigned

members.doc: A timestamp of the event.

members.name: version
members.doc: A meta site version. Monotonically increasing.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: role
members.doc: Defines the role for permissions

members.name: createComment
members.doc: Indicates whether commenting is enabled and with what role permissions

members.name: createReact
members.doc: Indicates whether reacting is enabled and with what role permissions

members.name: createReply
members.doc: Indicates whether replying is enabled and with what role permissions

members.name: query
members.doc: WQL expression

members.name: categories
members.doc: The retrieved Categories

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Paging metadata.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: filter
paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: ratingRequired
members.doc: Indicates whether leaving a rating is required

members.name: ratingsEnabled
members.doc: Indicates whether ratings are enabled

members.name: iconType
members.doc: Type of icon to be used for reactions

members.doc: Type of icon to be used for reactions

members.name: instanceId

members.name: namespace

members.name: originMetaSiteId
members.doc:
A meta site id from which this site was created.

In case of a creation from a template it's a template id.
In case of a site duplication ("Save As" in dashboard or duplicate in UM) it's an id of a source site.

members.name: originTemplateId
members.doc: A template identifier (empty if not created from a template).

members.name: ownerId
members.doc: An account id of the owner.

members.name: siteName
members.doc: A meta site name (URL slug).

members.name: deleteContext
members.doc: A deletion context.

description: Soft deletion of the meta site. Could be restored.

members.name: deleteContext
members.doc: A deletion context.

description: Hard deletion of the meta site.
First publish of a meta site. Or subsequent publish after unpublish.

members.name: newSiteName
members.doc: A new meta site name (URL slug).

members.name: oldSiteName
members.doc: A previous meta site name (URL slug).

description: Rename of the site. Meaning, free public url has been changed as well.

members.name: newOwnerId
members.doc: A new owner id (user that accepts meta site).

members.name: oldOwnerId
members.doc: A previous owner id (user that transfers meta site).

members.name: urls
members.doc: A list of URLs previously associated with the meta site.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.
